p: The median incubation period of COVID-19 has been estimated to be 5.1 days, and estimated that nearly all infected persons who have symptoms will do so within 12 days of infection. Clinical descriptions of asymptomatic phases after possible exposure range from 2 to 14 days. A 14-day period for monitoring after potential exposure is generally recommended, and modeling predicts that 101 out of every 10,000 cases (99th percentile) will develop symptoms after 14 days of active monitoring or quarantine [ 28].
